duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain proficient knowledge of EDC functionality for training, change proposals, and user acceptance testing.
Establish and maintain relationships with site data & regulatory coordinators.
Responsible for Quality Control of submitted Case Report Forms (CRFs) including source document verification and issuing queries.
Act as an Evaluator for the internal Clinical Research Coordinator in training; provide extensive, informative feedback to the trainee.
Maintain regulatory documentation for all assigned sites and study staff.

Support and adhere to Good Clinical Practices (GCP) guidelines, FDA, Institutional Review Board (IRB) and HIPPA regulations, Site Operating Procedures, and ethical standards for the conduct of research clinical trials.
Work closely with onsite team to confirm appropriate consenting is being performed and documented prior to data abstraction.
Communicate effectively with the research team, investigator(s), study sponsor and ancillary staff.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree preferred, 3-5 years of experience in data collection activities within a GCP/clinical research regulatory environment.
Experience with EDC systems and Clinical study experience in Oncology.
Strong medical terminology understanding and good written and verbal communication skills in English.
Proposal, implementation, and evaluation of appropriate resolutions.
Completion of pre-employment process including criminal background check, drug screening, and reference verification.
